page.title: 13OLD AND NEW TOWN EYEMOUTH
page.content: Very little remains of Eyemouth Old Town,once a warren of wynds and vennels dating from the 17th C,although there is still evidence of this in buildings around the harbour and in Home St.,where sandstone houses have walls two feet thick.The design of the Old Town gave protection from storms and also helped foil excisemen when Eyemouth had a reputation for smuggling.Deanhead housing scheme built in 1970 incorporated many old fishing town features.Modern"vennels" give communal access to the rear of the houses.Small gardens are a reminder of how little time fishermen had for gardening.Bright paintwork recalls how fishermen used left-over paint from their boats to brighten up their houses.Special cobbled areas add further character to the scene.
